text:
I work with genetics in a flu lab with the corona-guys sitting in the next door office. I strongly suspect it's been getting less virulent over time, but there is no way we can prove it, since we have mediocre estimates of infection fatality ratio, and we have very poor estimates of it when we factor in the changing treatment over time and other confounding factors. So it's just an unsupported hypothesis at this time.
The mink ones were probably not more virulent either, the problem was that it was an immune escape mutant which could make the vaccine less efficient

text: Yeah, it's going to take some really good animal models and several years to get a handle on it

elements.text: Yeah, it's going to take some really good animal models and several years to get a handle on it
